title: REVIEW --- Play: News Quiz
text:
B. Winston Churchill

C. Anthony Eden

D. Harold Macmillan

---

2. Activist investor Vivek Ramaswamy is pushing Chevron -- to do what?

A. Go all in on renewables

B. Pump more fossil fuels

C. Sell itself to Warren Buffett

D. Acquire Occidental Petroleum

---

3. Chilean voters rejected a proposed new constitution, leading to a cabinet reshuffling by the president. Who's that?

A. Gabriel Boric

B. Michelle Bachelet

C. Carolina Toha

D. Mauricio Morales

---

4. Clothing makers may start selling more garments made from unblended cloth. Why?

A. Fashionistas are reading Leviticus

B. Fire safety lawsuits

C. A Chinese tariff quirk

D. Ease of recycling

---

5. Who's just begun to divide their consulting and auditing businesses?

A. Deloitte

B. KPMG

C. Ernst & Young

D. Pennypacker Poole

---

6. A judge allowed Elon Musk to amend his countersuit against Twitter -- by adding what?

A. Mismanagement charges from a whistleblower

B. Tax returns showing he can't afford to buy Twitter

C. Compromising texts from Jack Dorsey

D. Allegations that social media causes tooth decay

---

7. Official portraits of Barack and Michelle Obama were unveiled -- where?

A. The White House

B. The National Gallery

C. The National Portrait Gallery

D. The Art Institute of Chicago

---

8. A 31,000-year-old skeleton missing a foot may represent the earliest known case of amputation. Where was it found?

A. Tonga

B. New Guinea

C. Madagascar

D. Borneo

---

9. Porsche is going public. Who will continue to own 75% of the shares?

A. Mercedes

B. BMW

C. Volkswagen

D. Stellantis

---

ANSWERS

1. B

2. B

3. A

4. D

5. C

6. A

7. A

8. D

9. C
